Prerequisites: ACG 3113 WITH A GRADE OF C OR BETTER (NOT C-).
Course Description: THEORY AND PRACTICE UNDERLYING STOCKHOLDERS' EQUITY, DILUTIVE SECURITIES AND EPS, DERIVATIVES, REVENUE RECOGNITION, POST-RETIREMENT BENEFITS, ERROR ANALYSIS, FULL DISCLOSURE, AND OTHER CURRENT ACCOUNTING TOPICS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
A. OBJECTIVES / OUTCOMES 
STUDENTS ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE A KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING TOPICS UPON COMPLETION OF ACG 4123: STOCKHOLDERS' EQUITY, DILUTIVE SECURITIES AND EPS, REVENUE RECOGNITION, DERIVATIVES, POST-RETIREMENT BENEFITS, ERROR ANALYSIS, DISCLOSURES, AND OTHER CURRENT ACCOUNTING TOPICS. 
B. MAJOR TOPICS 
PLEASE SEE A. ABOVE - STOCKHOLDERS' EQUITY, DILUTIVE SECURITIES AND EPS, REVENUE RECOGNITION, DERIVATIVES, POST-RETIREMENT BENEFITS, ERROR ANALYSIS, DISCLOSURES, AND OTHER CURRENT ACCOUNTING TOPICS.
Textbook(s): INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING BY KIESO, WEYGANDT AND WARFIELD (12TH EDITION, WILEY, 2007)
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
